channel.title: Help!
channel.description: Whenever someone or myself do a command on my server, it automatically gives a message to all that you did it. I was wonder how to stop this. It started messing up when I was editing my yell command and adding a "say" command to send a message to all without a name.

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

I just posted yell above -.-

Read full topic

item.title: Help!

item.description:
@Lol_zezima_died wrote:

Post some snippets of your commands. Like the ones it is “yelling” when you use them.

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @timmarus1 timmarus1
item.description:
@timmarus1 wrote:

This is my yell command:

else if (command.startsWith("yell") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 0)
		 { String titles = "";

if(playerRights == 1) {
titles = "[Moderator]";
}
if(playerRights == 2) {
titles = "[Administrator]";
}
if(playerRights == 3) {
titles = "[CO-OWNER]";
}
if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Timmarus")) {
titles = "[OWNER]";
}
if(playerRights == 0) {
titles = "[Player]";
}
if(playerRights == 4) {
titles = "[Player]";
}
if(playerRights == 10) {
titles = "[Player]";
}
//yell(titles + "" + playerName + ": ");
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = titles+" "+ playerName + ": "+ command.substring(5);





		}

That’s not the point though. The point is that everytime someone uses a command, it sends a message to all of whatever he did, removing the first 3 letters

Read full topic

item.title: Help!
item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

You use your sendMessage method (or whatever it is).

if(command.startsWith("commandhere") && playerRights = 0) { //command stuff here sendMessage("Message here"); }//closing bracket

You just use your send message method.

(Messy code ^^)

Read full topic
